legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Mizanoros casts a spell.

legendary.name: Accursed Step (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Mizanoros magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Mizanoros can then choose one creature he can see within 5 feet of him. The target must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 44 ({@damage 8d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Mizanoros regains hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Elson's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks), requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Elson is an 18th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Elson regains his expended spell slots when he finishes a short or long rest. He knows the following warlock spells:

spells: {@spell eldritch blast} (4 beams, +5 to each damage roll)

trait.name: Eldritch Heads (6/Day)
entries: When Elson hits a creature with an attack, he can cause the target to take an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage. Alternatively, as a bonus action, Elson can regain 11 ({@dice 2d10}) hit points. While Elson has at least one use of this trait remaining, he can't be {@status surprised} and creatures with the Pack Tactics trait gain no benefit from that trait against him.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Frenzy {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., up to four targets. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d8}) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of Elson's next turn.

variant.name: Ochre Elson with Morath, Scepter of the Soul Vortex
entries: Morath, Scepter of the Soul Vortex is an artifact born from a fragment of the Thousand Voices. At the GM's discretion, Elson can wield the scepter, causing the following changes to his stat block:

items: He has a challenge rating of 12 (8,400 XP).
He has resistance to necrotic damage.
He gains a +3 bonus to his spell attack rolls and spell save DC, including for his Eldritch Roar action option (spell save {@dc 20}, +12 to hit with spell attacks).
He knows the {@spell chill touch} cantrip, and can cast the {@spell finger of death} spell once per day.
He has the Bestow Greater Curses and Morath, Scepter of the Soul Vortex traits, as well as the Phantasmal Skull action option (all described below).

entries.name: Bestow Greater Curse (1/Day)
entries: When Elson casts {@spell bestow curse} he can force the target to make its saving throw with disadvantage. On a failed save, the target is simultaneously cursed by all four of the spell's listed options.

entries.name: Morath, Scepter of the Soul Vortex
entries: The rod has 8 charges and regains {@dice 1d3 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. When Elson reduces a humanoid to 0 hit points, the rod regains 1 expended charge. While holding the rod, Elson can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save {@dc 20}, attack bonus +12) from it: bestow curse (1 charge), circle of death (4 charges), confusion (2 charges), insect plague (3 charges), ray of enfeeblement (1 charge), or speak with dead (1 charge).

entries.name: Phantasmal Skull
entries: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage, and Elson regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ogden is a 15th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Empowered Undead
entries: Any undead that is under Ogden's control has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead. In addition, it gains a +5 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, and its hit point maximum increases by 20.

trait.name: Leech (5/Day)
entries: When Ogden hits a creature with his quarterstaff that isn't a construct or undead, he can choose to deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage and regain hit points equal to the number rolled.

action.name: Leeching Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

bonus.name: Grave Sacrifice
entries: As a bonus action, Ogden can cause one undead under his control to drop to 0 hit points. When he does so, he gains 14 ({@dice 4d6}) temporary hit points.

reaction.name: Grim Revival (3/Day)
entries: Immediately after Ogden kills a humanoid, he causes it to rise as a zombie under his control, as if by the {@spell animate dead} spell.

trait.name: Militaristic Resolve
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Pegasus Training
entries: The knight has advantage on ability checks and saving throws it makes to remain mounted on a pegasus. In addition, while mounted, the knight's normal and long ranges of thrown weapons are doubled (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two attacks.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. (60/240 ft. while mounted), one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit (with disadvantage if the target is within 5 ft.), reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The knight is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Bonded Mount
entries: The knight is magically bonded to its pegasus mount, which obeys the knight's commands. If the knight isn't mounted, it can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto its pegasus, provided the two are on the same plane of existence. When it teleports, the knight appears astride its mount, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. While mounted, the knight can force an attack or spell targeting the pegasus to target the knight instead, and both the knight and its pegasus have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. If its mount dies, the knight can train a new pegasus to serve as its bonded mount over the course of one month.

trait.name: Celestial Favor
entries: When the knight or its mount hit with an attack, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage (included in the attacks below).

trait.name: Militaristic Resolve
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Pegasus Training
entries: The knight has advantage on ability checks and saving throws it makes to remain mounted on a pegasus. In addition, while mounted, the knight's normal and long ranges of thrown weapons are doubled (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two attacks and uses its Strike Order.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. (60/240 ft. while mounted), one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit (with disadvantage if the target is within 5 ft.), reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Strike Order
entries: The knight chooses one friendly creature within 60 feet of it. If the target can see or hear the knight, the target can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack.

action.name: Heroic Rally (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The knight bellows a command, emboldening each creature it chooses within 60 feet of it that can hear it. Each target gains 15 ({@dice 2d10 + 4}) temporary hit points and becomes immune to being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The psybird doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The psybird doesn't understand any languages, but can communicate telepathically with other creatures it chooses within its telepathy range. This telepathy can convey emotions or fleeting sensory memories, such as faint echoes of sounds it has heard, or flashes of images it has seen.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hypnotizing Plumage {@recharge}
entries: The psybird attempts to vex nearby creatures with its psionic calls and dazzling plumage. Each creature within 30 feet of the psybird that can see or hear it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the psybird for 10 minutes.
When a creature becomes {@condition charmed} by this effect, apply one of the effects below at random for as long as the creature remains {@condition charmed}.

action.name: 1 Hazy Sight
entries: The creature is unable to see with any definition further than 10 feet from itself. The affected creature is considered to be {@condition blinded} to any creature or object further than 10 feet from itself, as they appear to it only as blurry, amorphous blobs of color.

action.name: 2 Confusion
entries: The creature suffers the effects of the {@spell confusion} spell, though the psybird doesn't need to maintain {@status concentration} on it. The affected creature can repeat its save at the end of each of its turns, ending the charm on itself on a success.

action.name: 3 Stupefaction
entries: The creature suffers disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks it makes that use either Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. The creature also temporarily forgets any languages it knows except for the one it has known the longest.

action.name: 4 Dizziness
entries: Any turn in combat during which the creature uses more than half of its movement speed, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. Each time this happens, the creature can repeat its save, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The jam can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the jam remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a mass of grape jam.

trait.name: Limited Spell Resistance
entries: The jam has advantage on saving throws against spells of 1st level or lower.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The jam regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the jam takes necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the jam's next turn.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the jam dies, it regains all its hit points and becomes active again in 24 hours unless its remains are eaten, destroyed, or targeted by a {@spell dispel magic} spell.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the golem remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary pile of garbage.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature other than a refuse golem that starts its turn within 10 feet of the golem, must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned|phb} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all refuse golems for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing or slashing damage (golem's choice).

action.name: Hurl Junk
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Missile Absorption
entries: When the golem is hit by a ranged weapon attack, it absorbs the projectile into its form. When it does so, the damage it takes from the attack is reduced by 11 ({@dice 2d10}). A creature within 5 feet of the golem can take an action to pull an absorbed projectile out of it with a successful {@dc 15} Strength check.

monster.name: Rocborne Chief
languages: Common plus up to three other languages

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chief is a 13th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). They know the following ranger spells:

trait.name: Guiding Wind (1/Turn)
entries: The chief can deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack. Alternatively, when the chief misses with a weapon attack, they can reroll the attack roll against a different target; the new target must be within 15 feet of the original target and within range of the weapon.

trait.name: Windswept
entries: The chief ignores any movement penalty caused by strong wind and they can't be pushed because of strong wind against their will.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chief makes two attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Rocborne Chief with Nimbus, First Staff of the Thunderbirds
entries: A chief in possession of Nimbus, first staff of the Thunderbirds is revered, for they've been blessed by their ancestors' spirits. Such a chief is considered a 13th-level ranger and uses the Rocborne chief stat block with the following changes:

items: They have a challenge rating of 8 (3,900 XP).
They know the {@spell shillelagh} cantrip.
They have the Nimbus, First Staff of the Thunderbirds trait, as well as the Nimbus, First Staff of the Thunderbirds and Buffet (Nimbus Special Attack) action options (all described below).

entries.name: Nimbus, First Staff of the Thunderbirds
entries: The staff has 8 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, the chief can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save {@dc 15}) from it: {@spell lightning bolt} (3 charges), {@spell shatter} (2 charges), {@spell spirit guardians} (3 charges), or {@spell wind wall} (3 charges).

entries.name: Nimbus, First Staff of the Thunderbirds
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit (+9 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

entries.name: Buffet (Nimbus Special Attack)
entries: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The rot monster has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

trait.name: Limited Flight
entries: The rot monster can only fly for up to 1 minute at a time. While flying, it has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}. If it ends its turn in the air after 1 minute of consecutive flight and nothing else is holding it aloft, it falls.

trait.name: Rot Wood
entries: Any nonmagical weapon made of wood that hits the rot monster rots and deteoriates. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of wood that hits the rot monster is destroyed after dealing damage.

trait.name: Waste Scent
entries: The rot monster can pinpoint, by scent, the location of rotting food and other decaying organic matter within 1 mile of it.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: The rot monster touches a nonmagical object made of organic matter that it can see within 5 feet of it, causing it to rot and deteriorate. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw to avoid the rot monster's touch.

If the object touched is either armor made of leather or hide, or a wooden shield being worn or carried, it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held wooden weapon, it deteriorates as described in the Rot Wood trait.

trait.name: Desert Camouflage
entries: The lizard has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lizard makes two attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target takes another 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. Each time the lizard hits the {@condition poisoned} target with this attack, the damage dealt at the start of each of its turns increases by 4 ({@dice 1d8}). If the {@condition poisoned} target receives magical healing or a creature uses a healer's kit on the target, the target can repeat the Constitution saving throw, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spit Venom
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one target. {@h}The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The spider has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has {@status surprised}.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The spider can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Seize
entries: If the spider has advantage on an attack roll and hits a creature that is Large or smaller, the creature is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sanguinor's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The sanguinor can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Aura of Punishment
entries: Whenever a hostile creature within 10 feet of the sanguinor takes damage, that creature takes an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sanguinor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The sanguinor's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the sanguinor can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sanguinor makes three attacks: one with its sting and two with its trident. It can cast any of its at will spells in place of one trident attack.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@dice 3d4 + 8}) piercing plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned}. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Boil Blood {@recharge 5}
entries: The sanguinor attempts to magically boil the blood of up to three creatures it can see within 120 feet of it. Each target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 39 ({@damage 6d12}) fire damage and 39 ({@damage 6d12}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that is {@condition poisoned} by a sanguinor's sting has disadvantage on this saving throw, and a creature that doesn't have blood is immune to this effect.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the scarapit has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The scarapit has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Noxious Resilience
entries: The scarapit can breathe normally in any environment, and it has advantage on saving throws made against harmful gases and vapors (such as {@spell cloudkill} and {@spell stinking cloud} effects, inhaled poisons, and the breath weapons of some dragons).

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The scarapit can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Subterranean Explorer
entries: While the scarapit is underground, it always knows how far it is from the surface, it can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} while it isn't {@condition incapacitated}, and it has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks made to track creatures.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage, or 21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) piercing damage if the target is {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: The seed coin is indistinguishable from a normal copper piece. However, a creature that has {@sense truesight} sees a deep red aura radiating from the seed coin, and a creature within 30 feet of it that is under the effect of a {@spell detect poison and disease} spell senses the insidious nature of the seed coin and knows it is a plant creature.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The seed coin doesn't require sleep. If the seed coin spends 1 minute in direct sunlight or a creature spends 1 hour in direct sunlight while the seed coin is on the creature's person, the seed coin receives enough nourishment to sustain itself for one day. When the seed coin dies, it becomes an ordinary copper piece.

action.name: Infestation
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 0 ft., one humanoid that has the seed coin on its person. {@h}The creature must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or its mind becomes imperceptibly infected with a disease until the seed coin is no longer on the creature's person or the creature dies. Creatures immune to the {@condition charmed} condition are immune to this disease, and a creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this disease for the next 30 days. The seed coin's influence invades a diseased creature's mind, killing the creature in a number of hours equal to {@dice 1d12} + the creature's Wisdom score, unless the disease is removed. In half that time, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} for the rest of the duration and refuses to part with the seed coin.

If a diseased creature dies while the seed coin is on its person, it immediately regains all its hit points and becomes a {@creature seed coin pollinator|GriffonsSaddlebag2}, as the seed coin takes over its body. The seed coin doesn't gain access to the creature's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies while controlling a creature in this way. This infestation lasts until the {@creature seed coin pollinator|GriffonsSaddlebag2} dies, killing the seed coin.

variant.name: Silver Seed Coin
entries: A rare breed, these seed coins bear an uncanny resemblance to a typical silver piece. Though less prevalent, they are even more potent than their copper kin. Such a silver seed coin uses the seed coin stat block, with the following changes:

items: It has a challenge rating of 1 (200 XP).
Its Intelligence and Charisma scores each increase to 14.
It has immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.
It is indistinguishable from a normal silver piece, and it becomes an ordinary silver piece when it dies.
It has the Innate Spellcasting trait below, which it retains after it becomes a seed coin pollinator.
The saving throw for its Infestation increases to DC 12, and it kills a diseased creature in a number of hours equal to {@dice 1d6} + the creature's Wisdom score, rather than {@dice 1d12}.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: The seed coin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). The seed coin can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

items: At will: {@spell prestidigitation}
3/day each: {@spell comprehend languages}, {@spell misty step}
1/day each: {@spell locate creature}, {@spell suggestion}

monster.name: Seed Coin Pollinator
languages: the languages its host knew in life

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: The pollinator is indistinguishable from a normal commoner, and it appears and sounds exactly like the creature it was before becoming infested. However, a creature that has {@sense truesight} sees a deep red aura radiating from the pollinator, and a creature within 30 feet of it that is under the effect of a {@spell detect poison and disease} spell senses the insidious nature of the pollinator and knows it is a plant creature.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The pollinator doesn't require sleep. If the pollinator spends 1 hour in direct sunlight, it receives enough nourishment to sustain itself for one day. When the pollinator dies, it becomes an ordinary humanoid corpse.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage.

action.name: Coin Spray {@recharge}
entries: The pollinator hurls a flurry of {@creature seed coin|GriffonsSaddlebag2|seed coins} at one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 4d4}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, one of the seed coins gets lodged on the target's body (for example, in a pocket or a fold in its clothing).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whale makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the whale. A swallowed creature has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the whale, and it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage at the start of each of the whale's turns.

If the whale takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the whale must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the whale. If the whale dies, a swallowed creature can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage.

trait.name: Enervating Aura
entries: Any creature other than an undead that starts its turn within 30 feet of the phantom must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. Whenever an {@condition unconscious} target takes damage or another creature uses an action to try to shake it awake, the target can make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Ethereal Form
entries: While on the Material Plane, attack rolls against the phantom are made with disadvantage unless the phantom is {@condition incapacitated}. In addition, the phantom can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the phantom fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The phantom has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Spectral Enthrallment
entries: Whenever the phantom reduces a humanoid to 0 hit points, the target dies and a specter rises from its corpse. The specter acts immediately after the phantom's initiative count and is under the phantom's control for 1 hour, after which time it vanishes.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The phantom is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phantom makes two Life Drain attacks. It can use its Dream Eater in place of one attack.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage, and the target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and on a successful save, its hit point maximum is reduced by half that amount. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The creature dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Dream Eater
entries: The phantom taps into the nightmares of one creature it touches. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be subjected to the effects of the {@spell phantasmal killer} spell for 1 minute (this effect doesn't require the phantom's {@status concentration}). The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. An {@condition unconscious} creature makes its saving throws against this effect with disadvantage, and whenever it takes damage from this effect, the phantom regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

bonus.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action, the phantom can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

legendary.name: Ghostly Swipe
entries: The phantom makes a Life Drain attack. Before or after the attack, it can move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Ethereal Banishment (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The phantom casts {@spell banishment} (save {@dc 20}), requiring only somatic components and targeting a creature it can see within 5 feet of it. If the target is native to and currently on the Material Plane, it is banished to its corresponding location on the Ethereal Plane, instead of a harmless demiplane. If the target takes any damage while there, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success. If the phantom concentrates on the spell for its full duration and the target is in the phantom's Enervating Aura when the spell ends, the target doesn't return.

legendary.name: Devour Dreams (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The phantom causes a wave of dread to erupt from a point it chooses within 120 feet of it. Each creature within 30 feet of that point is subjected to the phantom's Dream Eater effect.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The scholar is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The student is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft ., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Bird Caller
entries: The captain can cast the {@spell animal messenger} spell, but only as a ritual and only targeting a beast that has an innate flying speed.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The captain rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Launch (5/Day)
entries: As a bonus action while on the ground, the captain jumps up to 30 feet. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, and the captain takes no falling damage when it lands. The captain can't use this trait if its speed is 0.

If the captain hits a target with an attack immediately after it lands or during the leap's movement, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) damage, and it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Steel Jump (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the captain uses its Launch trait, it can choose to jump 90 feet, instead of 30.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes three attacks.

action.name: Silver Eagle Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage. Scoring a critical hit with this weapon doesn't double the weapon's damage dice. Whenever the same number is rolled on both of the weapon's damage dice, the target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Bird Caller
entries: The soldier can cast the {@spell animal messenger} spell, but only as a ritual and only targeting a beast that has an innate flying speed.

trait.name: Launch (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action while on the ground, the soldier jumps up to 15 feet. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, and the soldier takes no falling damage when it lands. The soldier can't use this trait if its speed is 0.
If the soldier hits a target with an attack immediately after it lands or during the leap's movement, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The soldier makes two attacks.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The storm spirit can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The storm spirit doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The storm spirit has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The storm spirit makes two Spirit Surge attacks.

action.name: Spirit Surge
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach o ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) lightning damage.

action.name: Storm Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 30 feet of the storm spirit must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage and 22 ({@damage 4d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Bloodmire Adaptation
entries: The mosquito is immune to the diseases described in the {@table Bloodmire Diseases|GriffonsSaddlebag2} table.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small mosquito. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Downpour
entries: If the swarm moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with an attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Freezing Rain
entries: If the swarm takes cold damage, whenever it hits a creature with an attack before the end of its next turn, the attack deals cold damage instead of its normal damage type.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny hornet. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Stings
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach Oft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The swarm can't be affected or detected by spells of 2nd level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects. In addition, if the swarm is subjected to a spell or other magical effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw.

trait.name: Scornful Reinforcement
entries: When the swarm kills a creature that has a familiar, the familiar joins the swarm, causing the swarm's hit point maximum and current hit points to increase by 10.

trait.name: Spell Detection
entries: The swarm immediately knows when a spell of 3rd-level or higher has been cast within 1000 feet of it, and it can sense the direction to the spellcaster's location.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny familiar.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes two attacks.

action.name: Spiteful Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) force damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Drain Magic
entries: The swarm attempts to siphon some magical power from a creature it can see within 10 feet of it. If the target has any remaining spell slots, it must make a {@dc 16} saving throw using its spellcasting ability. The target makes this saving throw with disadvantage if it has less than half of its spell slots remaining. On a failed save, the target loses one spell slot. Roll a {@dice d6} to determine the level of the spell slot lost. If the target has no remaining spell slots of that level, it instead loses its highest remaining spell slot below that level. The swarm then regains ({@dice 1d8}) hit points per level of the spell slot lost.

reaction.name: Arcane Barrier
entries: The swarm adds 3 to its AC against one attack that would hit it, as it creates an instantaneous shield of force around itself.

monster.name: The Thousand Voices, Supreme Soul Vortex

spellcasting.name: Remembered Spellcasting
headerEntries: At the start of each of the Thousand Voices's turns, it rolls a {@dice d4} to determine which list of spells is available to it until the start of its next turn. The Thousand Voices's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 16} to hit with spell attacks). The Thousand Voices can innately cast the following spells as a 20th-level spellcaster, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Deathly Chills
entries: At the start of each of the Thousand Voices's turns, each creature within 10 feet of the Thousand Voices takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

trait.name: Incorporeal Form
entries: The Thousand Voices can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. The Thousand Voices can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Thousand Voices fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The Thousand Voices is immune to spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Multiversal Intellect
entries: The Thousand Voices's AC includes its Intelligence modifier. In addition, when the Thousand Voices takes damage other than radiant damage while {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell, it automatically succeeds on the Constitution saving throw made to maintain {@status concentration}.

trait.name: Necrotic Absorption
entries: When the Thousand Voices is subjected to necrotic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

trait.name: 1 Bard
entries: The Thousand Voices can cast {@spell vicious mockery} or thunderwave as a 3rd-level spell (at will). It can also cast {@spell hypnotic pattern} (3/day) and power word kill (1/day).

trait.name: 2 Cleric
entries: The Thousand Voices can cast {@spell sacred flame} or guiding bolt as a 3rd-level spell (at will). It can also cast {@spell spirit guardians} (3/day) and inflict wounds as a 9th-level spell (1/day).

trait.name: 3 Sorcerer
entries: The Thousand Voices can cast firebolt and burning hands as a 3rd-level spell (at will). It can also cast {@spell fireball} (3/day) and finger of death (1/day).

trait.name: 4 Wizard
entries: The Thousand Voices can cast {@spell shocking grasp} and magic missile as a 3rd-level spell (at will). It can also cast {@spell lightning bolt} (3/day) and plane shift (1/day).

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The Thousand Voices is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Thousand Voices can use its Terrifying Visage. It then uses its Cacophonous Shriek or casts two spells of 3rd level or lower.

action.name: Cacophonous Shriek
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the Thousand Voices must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, with disadvantage if the target is within 5 feet of the Thousand Voices. A target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage and 28 ({@damage 8d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Extraplanar Shift
entries: The Thousand Voices enters the space between the planes from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It can remain in the space between the planes for up to 1 minute, and when it returns to the Material Plane, it reappears in a space of its choice within 60 feet of the space it left. While it is in the space between the planes, it can't affect or be affected by anything on any other plane.

action.name: Terrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the Thousand Voices that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target's speed is also reduced to 0 for the duration. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the Thousand Voices is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the Thousand Voices's Terrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Shift
entries: The Thousand Voices uses its Extraplanar Shift.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 1-3 Actions)
entries: The Thousand Voices casts a cantrip (1 action), a 3rd-level spell (2 actions), or a spell it can cast once per day (3 actions).

legendary.name: Shriek (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Thousand Voices uses its Cacophonous Shriek.

legendary.name: Maddening Outburst (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each creature within 10 feet of the Thousand Voices must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage, can't take reactions until the start of its next turn, and rolls a {@dice d4} to determine what it does during its next turn. On a 1 or 2, the target falls {@condition prone} and then ends its turn. On a 3, the target takes no action or bonus action and uses all its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 4, the target uses all of its movement to move within reach of a random creature, and then uses its action to make a melee weapon attack against that creature; if the target can't move within reach of another creature, it drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

legendaryGroup.name: The Thousand Voices, Supreme Soul Vortex

monster.name: The Wild Hunt

trait.name: Hunter's Prowess
entries: The Wild Hunt have advantage on attack rolls against a target if they are occupying the same space as the target and there are not other hostile creatures in The Wild Hunt's space.

trait.name: Incorporeal Swarm
entries: The Wild Hunt can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. The Wild Hunt can also move through any opening large enough for a Medium creature, and they can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. The Wild Hunt take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if they end their turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Wild Hunt have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Wild Hunt make two mauling rend attacks. They can use their Volley in place of one attack.

action.name: Mauling Rend
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage if The Wild Hunt have half their hit points or fewer.

action.name: Volley
entries: The Wild Hunt releases a flurry of arrows, targeting a point they can see within 120 feet of them. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If The Wild Hunt have half their hit points or fewer, a target instead takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or no damage on a successful one.

legendaryHeader: The Wild Hunt can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Wild Hunt regain spent legendary actions at the start of their turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Wild Hunt moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Rallying Horn (Below Half Hit Points Only)
entries: The Wild Hunt gain 13 ({@dice 2d12}) temporary hit points.

legendary.name: War Horn (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Whenever a target takes damage from The Wild Hunt before the end of their next turn, the target takes an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The thunderbird's innate spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 17}). The thunderbird can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The thunderbird has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The thunderbird deals double damage to objects and structures (included in {@spell Thunderclap|XGE}).

action.name: Nultiattack
entries: The thunderbird makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) lightning damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the thunderbird can't use its talons on another target.

action.name: Thunderclap {@recharge 5}
entries: The thunderbird flaps its wings, unleashing a powerful, concussive burst upon the surrounding area. The burst deals 100 thunder damage to all structures within 60 feet of the thunderbird, and each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 39 ({@damage 6d12}) thunder damage and is pushed 30 feet away from the thunderbird and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pixie's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Drunken Confessions
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the tipsy that has two or more levels of {@condition drunkenness|GriffonsSaddlebag2} (as per the Drunkenness rules from page 274 of this book) is under the effect of a {@spell zone of truth} spell. Whenever an affected creature tells the truth as a result of this effect, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or also be compelled to share a true feeling it has about one or more of the creatures to whom it's speaking.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tipsy has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Charm
entries: One humanoid the tipsy can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed}. If the {@condition charmed} creature is under the effect of a {@spell zone of truth} spell, it isn't aware of the spell and thus won't intentionally avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie.

Each time the tipsy or its allies ask the target a question, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts for 1 hour or until the tipsy dies, is on a different plane of existence from the target, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this tipsy's Charm for the next 24 hours. The tipsy can have no more than three creatures {@condition charmed} at a time.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The tipsy magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the tipsy wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it. Creatures with two or more levels of {@condition drunkenness|GriffonsSaddlebag2} are unaffected by this effect and can see the tipsy as if it wasn't {@condition invisible}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Vaanor's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). Vaanor can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Vaanor fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Vaanor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Soul Sentry
entries: Vaanor's weapon attacks are magical. When Vaanor hits an undead with a weapon attack, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: Vaanor has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Three Heads
entries: Vaanor has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks, as well as Constitution saving throws made to maintain {@status concentration} on spells.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: When one of Vaanor's heads is asleep, its other heads are awake. In addition, magic can't put it to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Vaanor can use its Inescapable Presence. It then makes three bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage. If this is the first attack Vaanor has made as part of its Multiattack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If this is the second attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of Vaanor's next turn. If this is the third attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the start of Vaanor's next turn.

action.name: Inescapable Presence
entries: Vaanor magically restricts one creature it can see within 120 feet of it from fleeing. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or become unable to willingly move or teleport away from Vaanor for 1 minute. Creatures that can't be {@condition frightened} are immune to this effect. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Vaanor's Inescapable Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Hellfire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Vaanor exhales debilitating fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage and 35 ({@damage 10d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Summon Hounds (1/Day)
entries: Vaanor magically summons ({@dice 4d4}) hell hounds. A summoned hell hound appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of Vaanor and acts as Vaanor's ally. It remains for 1 minute, until it or Vaanor dies, or until Vaanor dismisses it as an action.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: Vaanor makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Vaanor moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Trailblaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Vaanor moves up to twice its speed, leaving a trail of fire in its wake. During this movement, Vaanor doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, and it can move through the space of any creature that is Huge or smaller. Each creature in its path must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and 22 ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Until the end of Vaanor's next turn, each space it moved through is filled with an opaque, 20-foot-high wall of fire. Whenever a creature enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, it takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage.

legendary.name: Release the Hounds (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Vaanor uses its Summon Hounds.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Humanoid Form Only)
headerEntries: Vincent is a 12th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}), and he can't cast spells that require material components while in dragon form. He has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Draconic Weapons (Dragon Form Only)
entries: While in dragon form, Vincent's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In dragon form, Vincent makes two attacks: one with his bite and one with his claws. In humanoid form, he makes two sickle attacks.

action.name: Sickle (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit ({@hit 8} to hit with {@spell shillelagh}), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage with {@spell shillelagh}.

action.name: Bite (Dragon Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw (Dragon Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 6} (Dragon Form Only)
entries: Vincent exhales a plume of energy in a 25-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage of the type associated with Vincent's dragon type (see the {@table Dragon Damage Type|GriffonsSaddlebag2} table) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Change Shape (2/day)
entries: Vincent uses his action to magically polymorph into a Medium dragon of any type of his choice (see the {@table Dragon Damage Type|GriffonsSaddlebag2} table), or back into his humanoid form. When Vincent polymorphs, it gains 120 temporary hit points, and he can choose whether his equipment falls to the ground, melds into his new form, or is worn by the new form (if possible). He reverts to his humanoid form after 6 hours, if he dies, or if he falls {@condition unconscious}. His statistics are the same in each form, other than his AC and speed, as noted.

variant.name: Druidic Dragon Shapes
entries: When determining what dragon color and damage type a Crest City druid or similar creature should use when they use their Change Shape ability, use the table below.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The wyvernfly has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Prescience
entries: The wyvernfly can't be {@status surprised}.

trait.name: Steady Flight
entries: While flying, the wyvernfly has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against effects that would push it, pull it, or knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wyvernfly makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. It can use its Mark in place of one attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mark
entries: The wyvernfly marks a creature it can see as its prey. Until it marks a different creature, it has advantage on attack rolls against the target, and the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against the wyvernfly. In addition, its attacks against the target score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

Giant antlions are the kinds of creatures that inspire nightmares. Like their smaller relatives, giant antlions hide in sand or other loose earth, and wait to ambush hapless passersby with their deadly jaws, which resemble a massive, chitinous bear trap.

entries.name: Desert Trappers
entries: Once it has found a suitable location, an antlion will then set its trap. Juvenile and adult antlions will even dig a steep, conical pit lined with loose sand, creating a hazard that prey can easily slip and tumble down, rolling directly into the beast's waiting jaws.

entries.name: H'rethi Specimens
entries: In stark contrast to other regions, giant antlions of the H'rethi Desert seem to roam the dunes and dig their traps by night, resulting in occasional night ambushes and making it impossible to track their ever-changing territory.

monsterFluff.name: Alceton
entries: With the head of a moose, body and wings of a raptor, alcetons wander the frigid skies of northern climes and the upper echelons of snow-topped mountain ranges. Their favored prey are humanoids, especially dwarves. Indeed, some dwarven legends (especially in Heavensteppe) claim that roving alcetons are one of the foremost reasons dwarves belong below the surface.

monsterFluff.name: Ale Elemental
entries: These swirling and frothy, caramel-colored creatures smell of honey and hops. The existence of ale elementals has brought about hours of intense research and debate about the possibility of an elemental plane of alcohol or the like. Planar travel has thus far proved impossible, although these elementals are occasionally summoned by inebriated mages purposefully or accidentally. Regardless of their means of arrival, these creatures swarm towards areas with high concentrations of alcoholic beverages. As they pursue their murky agendas, they usually end up causing terrible havoc and general mayhem.

monsterFluff.name: Analeptic Lizard
entries: Scholars hypothesize that the Analeptic Lizard initially spawned in the wake of one of the many conjuration spells devoured by Grihoo. In most respects, it's indistinguishable from the average lizard or gecko. This reptilian creature has abnormally powerful regenerative abilities and keen intelligence for its size, making it surprisingly difficult to kill. Warlocks that successfully forge or force a bond with one of these strange lizards gain a tenacious and opinionated partner in crime.

entries.name: The Analeptic Lizard as a Familiar
entries: For rules on how you can use this and other patron-like creatures as a familiar for warlocks who have sworn the pact of the chain, read the sidebar on page 388.

monsterFluff.name: Antlions
entries: Giant antlions are the kinds of creatures that inspire nightmares. Like their smaller relatives, giant antlions hide in sand or other loose earth, and wait to ambush hapless passersby with their deadly jaws, which resemble a massive, chitinous bear trap.

entries.name: Desert Trappers
entries: Once it has found a suitable location, an antlion will then set its trap. Juvenile and adult antlions will even dig a steep, conical pit lined with loose sand, creating a hazard that prey can easily slip and tumble down, rolling directly into the beast's waiting jaws.

entries.name: H'rethi Specimens
entries: In stark contrast to other regions, giant antlions of the H'rethi Desert seem to roam the dunes and dig their traps by night, resulting in occasional night ambushes and making it impossible to track {@i their ever-changing territory}.

monsterFluff.name: Aqualisk
entries: Believed by many to be mere legend, the aqualisk is in fact the apex predator of Lake Ils. It has attained this mysterious status largely due to its ability to travel between the Material and Ethereal Planes at will. Though sightings are rare, it fiercely protects its territory from pirates, dragon turtles, and other threats. The Spire wizards are the only ones who are aware of its factual existence, and they offer it Beer-Battered Fish Sticks in exchange for its protection of Orostead. If something invades its underwater territory, it's quick to retaliate with full force.

monsterFluff.name: Archer Flower
entries: While most plants within a grymclover forest can pose an ample threat to the unwary, archer flowers are notoriously dangerous. They grow parasitically on tree roots, with budding flowers aimed at the canopy. Doing so ensures that climbing or flying creatures can be knocked down by their highly caustic spit; landing directly into their flytrap-like maws.

monsterFluff.name: Bardic Merchant
entries: Individuals that practice the bardic art of mercantile magic can be found across the land with independent goals and occupations.The various departments of Antronec's Mercantile Guild government are composed of many such individuals, but most of them are completely unaware of the guild's larger machinations. Regardless, the core leadership of the Mercantile Guild is composed of charismatic and manipulative merchants such as this. Eminent storytellers, arcanists, and economists, these capable bards administrate the bureaucratic spiderweb of the city and tug the puppet strings necessary to ensure their success. For them, wealth is power rightfully earned—making them both deserving and rightful custodians of Antronec.

monsterFluff.name: Bloodmire Treant
entries: The Syre Wood was home to numerous great trees and treants, but the swiftness of the Legion's assault left the forest's defense in the hands of Syre and his sprites. As such, the blood of Malfuriel has rapidly tainted the various treants of the swamp just as it altered the other wildlife. Those unlucky enough to draw a bloodmire treant's ire will face all of nature's wrath as well as the foul blood magic of Malfuriel, as these cursed treants possess the ability to animate pools of bloodwater into ooze-like forms as an additional means of defense.

monsterFluff.name: Bramble Creeper
entries: In these forests, the sound of rustling underbrush is almost always a dangerous omen. Bramble creepers take on the camouflaged appearance of briar clusters and are carnivorous, ambushing predators. These large plant creatures use their thorny vines to pierce and ensnare their prey, piercing and suffocating them into submission.

monsterFluff.name: Brimstone Drake
entries: Although not technically related to true dragons, brimstone drakes nonetheless share their temperament and general anatomy. Their molten forms are bound to black iron skeletons, allowing them to generate and conduct tremendous amounts of electricity. True to their name and draconic appearance, they utilize a breath weapon that sprays a cloud of blinding ash accompanied by red forked lightning.

monsterFluff.name: Butcher Dray, Three-Headed Ettin
entries: According to legend, the very tapestry of fate warps when a three-headed ettin is born. Indeed, the birth of Dray was a time of calamitous upheaval and magical chaos. Since that time, the Butcher has gathered hundreds of followers among giant-kin and smallfolk alike, unified by their voracious hunger for war and ritualistic blood magic. Found most commonly in mountainous regions, the Three-Headed Ettin and his disciples collect and offer sacrifices for enhanced strength and powerful blood-wrought spells.

Poorly organized, followers of the Butcher are typically militant and quick to begin confrontation. The same magical boons that make them ferocious warriors also tend to amplify their emotional instabilities and push them toward the bloodiest solution. Despite all of this, the Three-Headed Ettin has numerous followers and is considered one of the most generous warlock patrons.

Exceptionally gifted and skilled in his complex rituals and hemocraft, Dray fights with notorious ruthlessness. Many of his abilities are empowered by the blood of his enemies, and recovery from the deadly wounds of his knife is incredibly difficult. Adventurers that make the mistake of heavily wounding the Butcher will be faced with additional ferocity as the ettin's hunger for violence is eclipsed by unfettered rage.

entries.name: Sacrificial Peak
entries: High in the frigid mountains, the Butcher patiently gathers forces and influence through his vast network of followers and grisly magic. Here, the sheer number of sacrifices has bound Dray's frigid heart to the land, allowing him unparalleled control over the elements and increasing his magical might.

monsterFluff.name: Cartographer's Agent
entries: Most members of The Cartographer's Guild are simple mapmakers or merchants, but a special division known as The Cartographer's Agents handles the faction's dirtier business. These are the individuals that track and follow adventurers, using them as pawns to wear down the defenses of various dungeons and similar challenging locations. If these unknowing adventurers fall in combat, these agents are the ones that retrieve their belongings and treasures to fill the guild's coffers. If they survive, the agents can either finish them off and claim the wealth, or loot any leftover treasure that they were unable to acquire.

monsterFluff.name: Cerberus Pup
entries: No documentation exists entailing exactly where or when this miniature cerberi first appeared, and scholars can only speculate why. In what seems an utterly stark contrast to full-sized cerberi, the cerberus pup most often appears in the form of an adorable but three-headed puppy of any number of potential breeds. Regardless of appearance however, a cerberus pup is always a skilled tracker with far more energy than normal for its size, as at least one head is always awake. Those fortunate enough to bond with a pup typically earn their lifelong loyalty, unless the pup is sorely mistreated.

monsterFluff.name: Chantelle Redcliff, Mercantile Guildmaster
entries: Chantelle Redcliff, as the current Guildmaster of The Mercantile Guild, is accurately described as the most influential and powerful person in Antronec. The resources at her command within Antronec's government branches and underbelly are considerable, and she is more than willing to do whatever it takes to ensure that her guild retains its control over the city. She is exceptionally resourceful, and not to be underestimated—she has risen to her current role by proving herself the most capable politician and mage in The Mercantile Guild.

monsterFluff.name: Circle of Dragons Druid
entries: Druids of the Circle of Dragons typically take a supportive role while in combat, utilizing their spells to heal and empower their allies. However, if they become injured or face a truly imminent threat, they will wild shape into their powerful draconic form and unleash their full might with tremendous fervor.
These special druids are labeled in ascending order below by their strength and ranking within the Order.

monsterFluff.name: Cloverback Toad
entries: Named for the grymclover forests from where they originated, cloverback toads are unusually large amphibians with an acidic mucus coating on their skin. To make matters worse, paralyzing, toxic barbs grow on the tongues of these creatures, which they use as debilitating projectiles. For obvious reasons, the cloverback toad's acidic mucus and toxic barbs are also sought-after ingredients for use in deadly poisons.

monsterFluff.name: Crimson Legion Imp
entries: The Crimson Legionnaires are a swift, decisive, and efficient unit of infantry. In stark contrast to typical imps, Crimson Legion imps are zealous and obedient followers, known throughout the Lower Planes for their stubborn devotion to Malfuriel. With invisibility and silvered tongues, the art of war is second nature to them, and ensures that any battlefield conflict is skewed in their favor. They make frequent use of their shapechanging, becoming rats, hawks, and centipedes in order to scout, spy, or conceal their true numbers.

Made larger by fiendish blood magic, these imps are otherwise similar in appearance to their lesser brethren. Red skin in various shades, poison-dripping scorpion tail, bat-like wings and unique patterns of horns upon their heads all serve as identifying features.

monsterFluff.name: Cyglops
entries: Cyglopes are the result of a destructive mutation of the same phenomenon that creates geletons. These massive, hulking oozes take on a giant-like form and lumber through forests, collecting whatever skeletal remains they can find to reinforce their bodies and reanimate as thralls. Concentrated necrotic magic resides in the singular eye of a cyglops, which can be released as a focused beam of destructive force.

monsterFluff.name: Death Coach
entries: Known across the land in myth and song as a specter of terror, the death coach is a manifestation of death and harbinger of woe. This smoky black carriage pulled by horses dark as midnight is one with its headless driver. Within the carriage are countless wailing souls, but their screams go unheard. The legends claim that seeing the coach is to court misfortune, and hearing your name uttered by the coachman is an instant death sentence, as he instructs you to board the carriage with the other damned passengers.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A death coach doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

monsterFluff.name: Durheim Guide
entries: When Durheim monks have honed their soul to the point where the Walking the Liminal Path is the next stage of their destiny, they begin their journey as Guides. Along the Path, they travel across the land and dutifully seek out struggling spirits. When they feel the time is right, they return to record their experiences. As the main body of the Monastery's membership, Guides are often someone's first introduction to the Order.

monsterFluff.name: Durheim Initiate
entries: Those who have only recently begun to follow the teachings of Attiskin are referred to as initiates. These individuals have begun to open their eyes to the wonders and dangers of the Ethereal, but they are only fledglings. Some of these inexperienced monks feel the call to Walk the Liminal Path earlier than is typical—these brave souls are destined to accomplish greatness or fall to tragedy.

monsterFluff.name: Durheim Leader
entries: Within the walls and courtyards of Durheim Monastery, the Leader serves as spiritual and secular advisor. In this role, they give lectures and interpretations of Lightseer Attiskin's teachings and philosophies, and ensure that both the living and the dead can walk their respective paths safely.

monsterFluff.name: Dyra
entries: Fully recognizing their strengths and weaknesses, the dyra have spent centuries developing their mechanical prowess, acting as Magmarath's premier engineers. Some dyra have even developed juggernauts—metal and stone constructs that they can mold and stretch themselves around to pilot. While doing so, the dyra gains increased size and vigor from its sturdy framework, and also gains additional offensive and defensive capabilities as the juggernaut helps ground and redirect electricity.

monsterFluff.name: Dyra Juggernaut
entries: Infernal Barbarians take power from an infusion of fiendish energy, often transfused with blood magic, that imbues them with the wrath of the Lower Planes. Many of them are coerced into contracts and deals, while others seek this power willingly, or in a desperate attempt to survive the perils of the Iron Maw Arena.

monsterFluff.name: Elder Lava Wurm
entries: Occasionally, a lava wurm will live long enough and grow their vestigial wings large enough to become an elder. These creatures are an order of magnitude more dangerous than the young wurms, as their small but now functional wings allow them to more readily and swiftly follow their prey through molten rock and the open air. With their sheer bulk and love for fine granite, elder lava wurms are an infrequent but greatly feared invader of Heavensteppe, usually requiring many Steel Hawk lives to drive away.

monsterFluff.name: Ether Fish
entries: These small, silvery fish have developed the ability to shift between the Ethereal and Material Planes as a potent defense against their numerous predators. Ether fish can be found most reliably near bodies of fresh water, although their ability to fly notably adds clouds to the list of possibilities. Students of the Ethereal Plane speculate that the creatures—which have never been observed eating insects, algae, or similar visible food sources—might derive nutrients through environmental absorption.

monsterFluff.name: Etherean Trickster
entries: Lawbreakers are uncommon in etherean society, but their stringent laws place very little importance on the possessions of the denizens of other planes. Some ethereans make their living by 'liberating' valuable resources from their neighbors on the Material Plane, usually focusing on commodities not found on the Ethereal. For some, this means retrieving basic food, or raw materials for crafting; for others, it means fine jewelry or exquisite art.

monsterFluff.name: Festus Battlechef
entries: A veteran of both cuisine and combat, the battlechef is a devout warrior and an exemplary cook. Renowned for their magical prowess and strength of will, a battlechef goes where their deity and culinary sense of purpose lead. They are found most often behind the bar, within the bustling kitchen, slicing through enemies, or providing much-needed succor to those in need.

monsterFluff.name: Fleshcrafter
entries: Only the most reckless necromancers pursue the ancient, malevolent art of fleshcrafting. To them, the only perfection in life or undeath is that which they bestow. While they are immensely dangerous mages on their own, their power grows exponentially when acting in concert with their {@creature flesh golem|MM} creations.

monsterFluff.name: Flintclaw
entries: These lithe, fiendish felines actively stalk the shadowed alleyways of Magmarath in search of prey. In this way, they are very similar to predatory cats found on the Material Plane. Particularly renowned for their ferocity, flintclaws are protected by their dense black iron skeletons, and rend flesh like butter using their white-hot metal claws. They are also frequently utilized in the Iron Maw Arena as motivation for races and other timed events, to such a degree that mortal challengers are often nicknamed 'flintclaw fodder'.

monsterFluff.name: Geleton Adventurer
entries: Hapless adventurers that meet their untimely end in a corrupted forest sometimes return as a geleton: a symbiotic, collective lifeform between ooze and skeleton. Of such geletons, most can probably be found in the dungeons and ruins of these forests.
